description: THGP unites the voices of phenomenal women near and far. Created with sisterhood and storytelling in mind, author Alex Elle sits down with people who inspire her. From friends to family members and strangers, the hey, girl. guests give us a peek into their stories through candid and intimate conversations.

items.content:
Alex speaks to author and coach Octavia Raheem to discuss the power of pausing, getting still, and rest as self-care. 

Connect with Octavia here: https://octaviaraheem.comOctavia Raheem

Follow her here: @octaviaraheem

Alex sits down with Mariam to discuss how her interests of equity, diversity, and inclusion have been interwoven into her passions of making desserts, which has unexpectedly turned into an opportunity to fundraise for causes dear to her heart. 

Mariam can be found at @madewithlovebymariam (on Instagram). 
You can order from her directly through her DMs. 

Currently, pick-ups for her desserts are happening in the Greater Toronto Area (GTA), in Toronto, Ontario, Canada. 

————
The Hey Girl Podcast is mixed & produced by Wayne Bertram.

items.content:
Alex sits down with Hanahana Beauty founder, Abena, to discuss creative liberation, making space to learn, self-care through skincare, and community. 

Connect with Hanahana Beauty here.
Shop Hanahana Beauty here.

Support Abena's 10k for 10 Days fundraiser. Hanahana Beauty is holding their fourth bi-annual healthcare day for the Katargia cooperative in Tamale, Ghana. They will be providing vital medical services + education to the shea producers, pickers, and farmers of the cooperative. Donate today HERE.

items.title: Taylor on Ongoing Healing

items.content:
Alex sits down with therapist Jordan Ashley Madison to discuss healing as a community, taking care of ourselves during the pandemic, the importance of black mental health, and self-care as a therapist.

Connect with Jordan here.
Shop her merch here.

Jordan is a licensed couple and family therapist located in Bethesda, MD. She is passionate about helping couples build and maintain healthy relationships, and I aim to create a safe space for healing and growth in the Black community. In an effort to reduce the stigma around mental health.

Looking for a therapist? Jordan works at Friends in Transition Counseling Services, a Black-owned private practice in Bethesda, MD. Their website is here.  They have a selection of clinicians that are offering virtual sessions during the pandemic.
————
hey, girl. is mixed & produced by Wayne Bertram.

@alex_elle

items.title: Rachel Craven on Art as Joy

items.content:
Community, 
I'm excited to announce my new course for the quarter, Pathway to Peace. This offering was created to help you cultivate self-care and love through honest and vulnerable writing practice. Pathway to Peace will be centered on inner child journaling that will nurture who you are today and offer you supportive tips and tools on how to use writing as a consistent + daily tool that nurtures your younger (and current) self.
 
During our time together, we will be working through the following: 
 
Week 1: Nurturing Our Inner Child
Week 2: Making Peace with Our Past
Week 3: Holding Space for Self-Compassion
Week 4: Lessons + Letters Our Younger Self
 
It is going to be stretching and illuminating work! Looking forward to building through writing practice with everyone that joins. Registration closes on 7/30.

REGISTER HERE: https://www.alexelle.com/pathway-to-peace-course
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

items.title: Self-Care Writing Course + Live Zoom Wine Down

items.content:
Alex sits down with psychologist and Mindful Mamas' CEO, Terra LaRock, to vulnerably discuss mental health, surviving postpartum depression, OCD, and navigating self-care with mindfulness.

Are you a parent or caretaker looking for support? Terra's offering HGP listeners a free month on her Mindful Mamas app. iSO and Android users can use the link below to redeem.
 https://www.mindfulmamasclub.com/heygirlpodcast

Follow & connect with Terra on Instagram here.
Learn more about her here on her blog here.

————

hey, girl. is mixed & produced by Wayne Bertram.

@alex_elle
@theheygirlpodcast

items.title: Terra on Mindfulness + Self-Awareness

items.content:
I hope you all are doing well, staying safe, and taking as much taking as you can. As mentioned in the episode, I want to hear from you. See below for some updates and where to send your thoughts.


Email me a voice note of how you're doing these days at heygirlpodcast@alexelle.com. You may get an auto-reply, but we will make sure to listen to your notes. We'll be compiling a listener episode to air in a couple of weeks. Please leave your name and location in the note.

I’m preparing for the launch of my second virtual writing course called "A Journey Home" in April. With my in person retreats being canceled this year, I’ll be offering digital workshops and retreats to build with you and offer supporting in your writing practice. Make sure you’re on my email list (here) if you’d like info about registration. Cart opens 4/1.

I made this meditation as a love offering for us all. Enjoy it and share it.

Tuesday 3/31 at 2pm EST I will be going live on @alex_elle with my friend and former guest, Lisa Olivera (@lisaoliveratherapy). We hope to see you there! Come with questions and community conversation.


Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

items.content:
HGP Community,

I hope to see you this summer at one of my writing retreats. You do not need to be a "writer" to join us. I also believe that everyone can write, we just have to give ourselves permission, space, and grace to do so. Come as you are with an open mind + heart. See the links below for details and registration.

items.title: Charleigh on School & Art as Self-Care

items.content:
Now and then, I have people over, and we have vulnerable conversations about real-life experiences. This new hey, girl. segment will showcase some of those conversations. In honor of miscarriage and infant loss awareness month, I sat down with my dear friend (and previous guest) Josefina. We're discussing fertility, loss, staying hopeful, and walking through grief and self-care simultaneously.
Joesfina is a calligraphy artist, writer, and art therapy student. You can learn more about her at loveoffering.co. Follow her on Instagram @loveoffering.

Subscribe for Alex's free self-care writing practice here. 
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

items.content:
The first episode of author Alex Elle's hey, girl. - a podcast that unites the voices of phenomenal women near and far - arrives this Sunday, March 12. Alex sits down with people who inspire her - from friends to family members and strangers, the hey, girl. guests give us a peek into their stories through candid and intimate conversations. 
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices
